trans-unit.source: Specifies SQL Server-specific data type of a field, property, for use in a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref>.
When setting command parameters, the <xref:System.Data.SqlDbType> and <xref:System.Data.DbType> are linked.
Therefore, setting the `DbType` changes the `SqlDbType` to a supporting `SqlDbType`.
<xref href="System.Int64"></xref>.
A 64-bit signed integer.
<xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
A fixed-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref>.
An unsigned numeric value that can be 0, 1, or `null`.
<xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A fixed-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters.
Date data ranging in value from January 1,1 AD through December 31, 9999 AD.
<xref href="System.DateTime"></xref>.
Date and time data ranging in value from January 1, 1753 to December 31, 9999 to an accuracy of 3.33 milliseconds.
Date and time data.
Date value range is from January 1,1 AD through December 31, 9999 AD.
Time value range is 00:00:00 through 23:59:59.9999999 with an accuracy of 100 nanoseconds.
Date and time data with time zone awareness.
Date value range is from January 1,1 AD through December 31, 9999 AD.
Time value range is 00:00:00 through 23:59:59.9999999 with an accuracy of 100 nanoseconds.
Time zone value range is -14:00 through +14:00.
<xref href="System.Decimal"></xref>.
A fixed precision and scale numeric value between -10 <sup>38</sup> -1 and 10 <sup>38</sup> -1.
<xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
A floating point number within the range of -1.79E +308 through 1.79E +308.
<xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
A variable-length stream of binary data ranging from 0 to 2 <sup>31</sup> -1 (or 2,147,483,647) bytes.
<xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
A 32-bit signed integer.
<xref href="System.Decimal"></xref>.
A currency value ranging from -2 <sup>63</sup> (or -9,223,372,036,854,775,808) to 2 <sup>63</sup> -1 (or +9,223,372,036,854,775,807) with an accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a currency unit.
<xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A fixed-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters.
<xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A variable-length stream of Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 <sup>30</sup> - 1 (or 1,073,741,823) characters.
<xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A variable-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters.
Implicit conversion fails if the string is greater than 4,000 characters.
Explicitly set the object when working with strings longer than 4,000 characters.
Use <xref href="System.Data.SqlDbType.NVarChar"></xref> when the database column is `nvarchar(max)`.
<xref href="System.Single"></xref>.
A floating point number within the range of -3.40E +38 through 3.40E +38.
<xref href="System.DateTime"></xref>.
Date and time data ranging in value from January 1, 1900 to June 6, 2079 to an accuracy of one minute.
<xref href="System.Int16"></xref>.
A 16-bit signed integer.
<xref href="System.Decimal"></xref>.
A currency value ranging from -214,748.3648 to +214,748.3647 with an accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a currency unit.
A special data type for specifying structured data contained in table-valued parameters.
<xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A variable-length stream of non-Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 <sup>31</sup> -1 (or 2,147,483,647) characters.
Time data based on a 24-hour clock.
Time value range is 00:00:00 through 23:59:59.9999999 with an accuracy of 100 nanoseconds.
Corresponds to a SQL Server `time` value.
<xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
Automatically generated binary numbers, which are guaranteed to be unique within a database.
`timestamp` is used typically as a mechanism for version-stamping table rows.
The storage size is 8 bytes.
<xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
An 8-bit unsigned integer.
A [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] user-defined type (UDT).
<xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
A globally unique identifier (or GUID).
<xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
A variable-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.
Implicit conversion fails if the byte array is greater than 8,000 bytes.
Explicitly set the object when working with byte arrays larger than 8,000 bytes.
<xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A variable-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters.
Use <xref href="System.Data.SqlDbType.VarChar"></xref> when the database column is `varchar(max)`.
<xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
A special data type that can contain numeric, string, binary, or date data as well as the SQL Server values Empty and Null, which is assumed if no other type is declared.
An XML value.

Obtain the XML as a string using the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader.GetValue(System.Int32)"></xref> method or <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlXml.Value"></xref> property, or as an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> by calling the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlXml.CreateReader"></xref> method.
